#OneDayKC  
April 1, 2016

Thank you to everyone who participated in #OneDayKC 2016! Our KC community came together and had an incredible time. Watch our recap video and read our media coverage below.



#OneDayKC 2016


Read about our 2016 event from the Stanford-led University Innovation Fellows, Startland News, Rockhurst University, and Hilltop Monitor (William Jewell College).

The day after #OneDayKC, a panel discussion was held with student entrepreneurs, leaders from higher education, and catalysts of our entrepreneurial community from C.E.E.D. This discussion considered new pathways for universities and local businesses to collaborate. Read a summary in this Medium post by co-director Trevor Nicks.


About #OneDayKC


What is #OneDayKC?

#OneDayKC 2016 was a 12-hour innovation workshop and competition for college students and juniors/seniors in high school, held on Friday, April 1st, 2016. The event took place at the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation Conference Center from 8:00am to 5:00pm, with a public judging ceremony at Rockhurst University's Arrupe Hall beginning at 6:30pm. #OneDayKC was free to participants, and included awesome food and prizes for top teams.

Teams were mentored by faculty from the Stanford d.school, CEOs of local startups, sustainable architects, artists, service designers, and more. Talks included:

  • Design Thinking, Leticia Britos-Cavagnaro, University Innovation Fellows and Stanford d.school
  • The New Smart City, Bob Bennett, Chief Innovation Officer of Kansas City, Missouri
  • KC & Sustainable Development, Butch Rigby, Screenland Theaters
  • The Lean Process, Landon Young, Director of Creativity & Innovation, William Jewell College

With recent technological and infrastructural developments in Kansas City, like Cisco's Smart City initiative, the Streetcar, and rapidly-expanding Google Fiber, Kansas City is uniquely poised to become an even more amazing place to live and work in the next ten years. There is an incredible potential to design sustainable communities, leverage smart devices through the Internet of Everything, and create an efficient, flourishing city for 2025 and beyond — and for the second year in a row, we brought together the top young minds from the region to make it happen.

What did students do?

During #OneDayKC, students proposed and validated Lean startup experiments, focusing on solutions that leverage KC's momentum in becoming a Smart City and utilizing tools like the Business Model Canvas. Teams "got out of the building" by visiting the Plaza district of Kansas City, where they met with potential customers and gained feedback to guide their development. Students' ideas were transformed into business models and prototypes and then pitched to a panel of judges including Frank Jurden of VML and TEDxKC, Tom Gerend, Executive Director of the Kansas City Streetcar Authority, Dr. David Sallee, President of William Jewell College, and Humera Fasihuddin of the University Innovation Fellows.

Through the workshop, students were introduced to civic challenges in a variety of fields. We organized a team of mentors who are rockstars in technology, entrepreneurship, service design, hardware, architecture, urban planning, education, and sustainable thinking. With a wealth of expertise at their disposal, our teams of students created big-picture solutions through the power of a connected city and Lean methods, "failing fast" to validate their solutions and assumptions. Participants tackled complex problems, including:

  • Sustainability & Energy
  • Transit & Traffic
  • Municipal Services
  • Health & Well-being
  • Education & Workforce Development
  • Culture, Recreation, and Public Spaces

Who was involved?

This event was a collaborative effort between William Jewell College, Rockhurst University, and the University of Missouri - Kansas City’s Regnier Institute. The event was co-directed by Bradley Dice (WJC), Trevor Nicks (WJC), Macy Tush (WJC), Ben Shinogle (WJC), Alex Holden (WJC), Michael Brummett (RU), Mike Frazzetta (RU), and Tin Ho (UMKC), with mentorship from professors Landon Young (WJC), Risa Stein (RU), and Ben Williams (UMKC). A total of 60 students representing 18 schools from across the Midwest joined! Our participants were student innovators, entrepreneurs, problem solvers, engineers, designers, tech enthusiasts, and more.

#OneDayKC 2016 Team


Bradley Dice

Scientist, University Innovation Fellow, and liberal artist in his senior year at William Jewell College. Physics, chemistry, and math major passionate about computational research. Frequently hacks and grooves to the rhythm of life.

Trevor Nicks

Third-year student and University Innovation Fellow at William Jewell College studying Biochemistry, Applied Critical Thought & Inquiry, and Business Administration. Trevor is a cool, non-mad scientist. He's engineering bacteria to create biofuels, and aims to get both an MBA and a Ph.D. in Synthetic Biology. Trevor likes dogs.

Michael Brummett

Writer, activist, general trailblazer, and social entrepreneur. Studies nonprofit management and leadership studies at Rockhurst with a pinch of literacy, design-thinking, and human dignity. University Innovation Fellow and KCMO native invested in the city's future.

Macy Tush

Second-year student and University Innovation Fellow at William Jewell College studying Physics and Mathematics. She's passionate about innovation and creativity in all areas of study, especially user-centered thinking. Her future goals include learning to play ukulele, studying in Antartica, and attending law school to study IP law.

Tin Ho

Third-year business undergraduate pursuing a dual-degree in Accounting and Entrepreneurship at UMKC. To Tin, entrepreneurship is a passion, a labor of love, and a burning inner drive to create something out of nothing.

Ben Shinogle

Third-year student and University Innovation Fellow at William Jewell College studying Political Science and English.

Alex Holden

Third-year student and University Innovation Fellow at William Jewell College studying Philosophy, Economics, and Communication.

Mike Frazzetta

Outgoing leader, University Innovation Fellow, studying Business Management and Psychology at Rockhurst University. Passionate about music, entrepreneurship, and crazy socks. Always looking for a good movie to watch or an organization to start.
